Subject: RE: Corn Trade matrix

 

Hello Xavier,

 

apologies for the inconvenience this may have caused our dev team are actively working on solving this issue. in the meantime, refreshing the page should solve the issue.

 

as for your second point you should find it in the following path in the folder just make sure to open the .xlsm file for the one with MACROS & VBA not the .xlsx (they have the same name so it can be a bit confusing )

" G&O\05- COUNTRY_ANALYSIS\ARGENTINA\SND\CRN_ARG_SND.xlsm"



 

Please let me know if you have any more inquiries or if you need further assistance.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Thanks Saber, ok clear

-Also just in case the other path seems to have a similar issues in tradematrix tab this morning still get the following: cf img below

 -btw what is the excel spreadsheet in the Sharepoint where we can do something equivalent to this grids/forecast and adding/deleting monthly exports vs ref(lineup) that pablo and you showed us yesterday? thx
BR, Xavier



 

From: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> > 
Sent: Thursday, October 9, 2025 9:31 PM
To: RAOULT DE FORESTA Xavier <XARA@teruva-trading.com <mailto:XARA@teruva-trading.com> >; Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io <mailto:pablo.figueroa@dnext.io> >
Cc: DBAB Omar <OMDB@teruva-trading.com <mailto:OMDB@teruva-trading.com> >; RACEDO Leandro Daniel <LERA@teruva-trading.com <mailto:LERA@teruva-trading.com> >
Subject: RE: Corn Trade matrix

 

Hello Xavier,

 

Thank you for reaching out.

 

The path you mentioned seems correct , it appears to be a technical error on our end. Our development team has been notified and is currently investigating the issue.

Just to clarify, the correct way to create a Forecast is via the TradeMatrix:

1.	Click on the Forecast button.
2.	In the Forecast section, click Create.



 

3.	Specify the Name, Code (please use hyphens “-” instead of spaces or underscores for multi-word codes), and Color.
4.	Once created, click Load in the Forecast section, then check your forecast and move it from the left panel to the right.

 

 



 

After the forecast has been created, you can input data by directly editing the forecastable cells within the TradeMatrix.
You can then choose to either:

*	Save your changes to the current version of the forecast, or
*	Publish them as a new version.

(Please note that older versions cannot be modified , only the latest one can be edited.)

 



 

I hope this helps clarify the process. Please let me know if you have any further questions or need any additional assistance.

 

Best regards

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> 



 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

info@dnext.io <mailto:info@dnext.io>  | www.dnext.io <http://www.dnext.io/>

Cc: Omar Dbab <omdb@teruva-trading.com <mailto:omdb@teruva-trading.com> >; Leandro Racedo <lera@teruva-trading.com <mailto:lera@teruva-trading.com> >
Subject: Corn Trade matrix

 

Hola Pablo, Saber

can you remind us the path to get to the Matrix or maybe your cloud is down? 
I went to Tradematrix > corn line > visualize but got some issues and tried Tradematrix> Forecast> corn > Visualize and got the same error below when trying to create scenarios

BR

Hello Xavier,

 

apologies for the inconvenience this may have caused our dev team are actively working on solving this issue. in the meantime, refreshing the page should solve the issue.

 

as for your second point you should find it in the following path in the folder just make sure to open the .xlsm file for the one with MACROS & VBA not the .xlsx (they have the same name so it can be a bit confusing )

Thanks Saber, ok clear

-Also just in case the other path seems to have a similar issues in tradematrix tab this morning still get the following: cf img below

 -btw what is the excel spreadsheet in the Sharepoint where we can do something equivalent to this grids/forecast and adding/deleting monthly exports vs ref(lineup) that pablo and you showed us yesterday? From: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>
Sent: Thursday, October 9, 2025 9:31 PM
To: RAOULT DE FORESTA Xavier <XARA@teruva-trading.com>; Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>
Cc: DBAB Omar <OMDB@teruva-trading.com>; RACEDO Leandro Daniel <LERA@teruva-trading.com>
Subject: RE: Corn Trade matrix

 

Hello Xavier,

 

Thank you for reaching out.

 

The path you mentioned seems correct , it appears to be a technical error on our end. Our development team has been notified and is currently investigating the issue.

Just to clarify, the correct way to create a Forecast is via the TradeMatrix:

  1. Click on the Forecast button.
  2. In the Forecast section, click Create.

 

  1. Specify the Name, Code (please use hyphens “-” instead of spaces or underscores for multi-word codes), and Color.
  2. Once created, click Load in the Forecast section, then check your forecast and move it from the left panel to the right.

 

 

 

After the forecast has been created, you can input data by directly editing the forecastable cells within the TradeMatrix.
You can then choose to either:

  • Save your changes to the current version of the forecast, or
  • Publish them as a new version.

(Please note that older versions cannot be modified , only the latest one can be edited.)

 

 

I hope this helps clarify the process. Please let me know if you have any further questions or need any additional assistance.

 

Best regards

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io

 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

info@dnext.io | www.dnext.io

 

 

From: RAOULT DE FORESTA Xavier <XARA@teruva-trading.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 9, 2025 17:55
To: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>
Cc: Omar Dbab <omdb@teruva-trading.com>; Leandro Racedo <lera@teruva-trading.com>
Subject: Corn Trade matrix

 

Hola Pablo, Saber

can you remind us the path to get to the Matrix or maybe your cloud is down?
I went to Tradematrix > corn line > visualize but got some issues and tried Tradematrix> Forecast> corn > Visualize and got the same error below when trying to create scenarios

BR
